intro: Quercus glauca var. lacera, commonly known as the Chinese white oak, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its small, acorn-like fruits and broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in forested areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities. The leaves and acorns have been used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
